extendedMetadata.value: LO: 17.4: Why was the West a bonanza of dreams and get-rich-quick schemes?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Remember 17 05

config.question: To which region did African Americans move in the 1870s and 1880s, intending to establish the first African American state?

answer_3.response: Consider This: African Americans who left Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas to settle in a different state were called Exodusters. Fittingly, the state they aimed for was the home of John Brown and the Free-Soil campaigns of the 1850s. See L.O. 17.4 Why was the West a bonanza of dreams and get-rich-quick schemes?
